newsitem.title: FINLAND: Helsinki bourse to buy Computershare system.
newsitem.headline: Helsinki bourse to buy Computershare system.

text.p: The Helsinki Stock Exchange said on Tuesday it had chosen a new trading and information system to be supplied by the London office of Australian Computershare Systems Pty Ltd.
"The new system is to be introduced in the first half of 1998," the bourse said in a statement.
"The decisive factors in choosing the system have been to find a flexible, state-of-the-art solution. The system must be cost-effective, reliable and easy to manage," it said.

The system would be combined with the improved Microsoft Windows NT workstation software of the current HETI information and trading system and an open application program interface introduced last autumn.
The bourse said it allows trouble-free technical co-operation with the clearing centre and other stock exchanges.
The first version of the current HETI system was launched about 10 years ago, the bourse said.
